flawed_nl_solution:
Peter has 19 - 7 = <<19-7=10>>10 years of experience.
Robert has 10 - 4 = <<10-4=6>>6 years of experience.
Mike has 6 - 2 = <<6-2=4>>4 years of experience.
Tom has 2 * 6 = <<2*6=12>>12 years of experience.
Roger has 10 + 6 + 4 + 12 = <<10+6+4+12=32>>32 years of experience.
Roger has to work another 50 - 32 = <<50-32=18>>18 years before he retires.
#### 18

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 10. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
